choices.C: Admin page of the Cloud Service Console
choices.A: OS command line from the database server.

questions.question_text: Which method will NOT permit you to change the database Admin Password of a Autonomous Database on Shared Infrastructure? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.A: You can use Service console to enable or disable auto scaling of Autonomous DB.
choices.B: You can use Service console to manage runaway SQL statements on Autonomous DB.
choices.D: You can use Service console to create manual backups of Autonomous database.
choices.C: You can use Service console to move Autonomous DB between compartments.

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct about managing and monitoring of Autonomous Database? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content: It's 300x the number of OCPUs for TPURGENT, so the answer is 2700 - https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/manage-priorities.html#GUID-6E4DCD27-CDAA-432D-A90B-485C19EF72B0

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/adbsa/manage-service-concurrency.html#GUID-6E4DCD27-CDAA-432D-A90B-485C19EF72B0
300x the number of OCPU. OCPU is 9, so 9x300=2700
The number of OCPUs is the CPU Core Count shown in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Console.
Note:When connecting for replication purposes, use the low database service name. For example use this service with Oracle GoldenGate connections. 3x 300 = 900
auto-scaling does not impact parallelism or concurrency; so if the the ADB auto-scaled from 3 to 9 OCPU's, then the answer should be 3 x 300 = 900 .
I think the answer is 900. * 100 times the number of CPUs before we start queuing

questions.question_text:
You have an Autonomous Transaction Processing Database with three OCPUs and auto scaling turned on and your application is using the TPURGENT service.
The load on the database increases from three OCPUs to nine OCPUs.
What is the total number of concurrent statements that the TPURGENT service can support? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Schemas and tablespaces are objects. Data is not.
AD IS CORRECT. Tablespace is logical. We migrate data not tablespace.
data is not a object, AB is the answer
Is data a database object like schema?

questions.question_text: When using Data Pump to migrate your Oracle database to Autonomous Database, which two objects are imported? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Moving an Autonomous Database instance does not include its automatic backups.
choices.C: Autonomous Exadata Infrastructure instances and Autonomous Container Databases have no dependent resources that move with them. Associated (non- dependent) resources remain in their current compartments.
choices.A: Moving the compartment of the Autonomous Database will also move the Autonomous Container Database and Autonomous Exadata Infrastructure.
choices.D: You do not need to have sufficient access permissions on the compartment that the resource is being moved to.

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct with respect to required action to move Autonomous Database resources to a different compartment? (Choose the best answer.)
